Trimble is a global leader in telematics

generated from Global Positioning
devices the data they've transmitted is
position velocity and time essentially
we know where am I at any given time how

first that database was about six and a

about thirty three gigabytes a day we
use the data migration service and the

to analyze the scope of effort that
would be required to migrate from our
existing platform to an open-source
platform and the output from that
analysis was what allowed us to
understand where our functional gaps
were in what the effort to address them
would be without schema conversion tool
I would have had to rely on my resources
to try and figure out what if these
functional gaps are between our current

time required to do that would have you
know taken much longer than the tool
using the tool we literally had results
the same day we ran the schema
conversion tool against our Oracle
database and compared it against the
number of different platforms and it
turned out that Postgres offered the
path of least resistance in terms of the
actual data migration our in-house teams
focused on our front end solutions and
reporting solutions in our third-party
vendor did
data migration in terms of operational
overhead we have already seen
opportunities to reallocate resources
who used to maintain hardware
infrastructure now we're able to task
them with more value-added activities in
terms of database administration RDS has
allowed us to forget about things like
backups and capacity management and
patch management we're right in the
middle of migrating our our development
environments from privately hosted
infrastructure into AWS we're also
starting to expand the use of AWS
services with things like cloud
formation in code pipeline the success
of this project can only be attributed
to you know the team that we had
assignment to work on it you know from
their open-mindedness to work with a
third party to drive into the unknown of
a new platform and do this within the
time frames that were expected of them I
can't say enough about it we're about
80% complete on our migration to AWS and
our projections are that we will pay
about 1/4 of what we were paying in our
private infrastructure
